element.tip: Identifies a resource whose files this resource depends upon.
A listing of files that this resource is dependent on.
A node that describes the shape of the organization. It can reference a Resource or sub-Manifest. You can do this from the drop-down box.

The Manifest node of the Content Package contains all child elements and other sub-Manifests.

A reusable unit of instruction. Encapsulates meta-data, organizations, and resource references.

This element contains context specific meta-data that is used to describe the content of the overall package (Package level meta-data). If meta-data is provided, the meta-data must be valid IMS Learning Resource Meta-data.

You can edit the Metadata from the Edit menu or by clicking on the button on the toolbar.
This element describes a particular organization. Different views or organizational paths through the content can be described using multiple instances of the Organization element.

Describes one or more structures or organizations for this package. When defining a SCORM Resource Package, this element is required to be empty. When defining a SCORM Content Aggregation Package, this element is required to contain at least one organization sub-element.
A reference to a resource.
A collection of references to resources. There is no assumption of order or hierarchy.
Describes the schema that defines the meta-data. This element is optional, however if present it must contain the value of “ADL SCORM”.
Describes the version of the schema that defines the meta-data. This element is optional, however if present it must contain the value of “2004 4th Edition”.
Describes the title of the organization or item.

This element describes the location where the meta-data describing the package may be found. This may be a Universal Resource Indicator (URI).

ADL Note: This is an ADL extension to the IMS Content Packaging Information Model. This element can be used to reference a file that contains the meta-data. Either the meta-data is included in-line within the metadata element, or this element is used to provide the file location.
This element defines the action that should be taken when the max time allowed in the current attempt of the SCO represented by the item is exceeded.

This element provides a place for initialization data expected by the SCO represented by the item after launch. This data is unconstrained and undefined. Usage of this element is not yet well defined and should be used with caution.
An identifier that is unique within the Manifest.
Identifies the version of this Manifest (e.g., 1.0).
Indicates which organization scheme is the default one.
Has a default value of “hierarchical” for describing the shape of an organization.
A reference to a URL.
A reference to an resource in the resources section or a (sub)Manifest.
Indicates whether or not this item is displayed when the structure of the Package is displayed or rendered.
Static parameters to be passed to the resource at launch time.
Indicates the type of resource.
Provides the relative path offset for the content file(s).
Indicates the type of resource. This can be SCO or asset
